intro: Homalium urceolatum, commonly known as the urn-shaped evergreen. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
